intro: Tetraphyle, commonly known as the four-leaf clover, is a rare variant of the Oxalis genus. It is characterized by its four leaves, which are often considered a symbol of good luck. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is native to various regions in the Americas. Its leaves are heart-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. The flowers are usually small and yellow, appearing in clusters during the spring and early summer.
